Package game.enemies

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
game.enemies.Enemy
All Implemented Interfaces:

Direct Known Subclasses:
Dog, GiantEnemy, GodrickSoldier, GodrickTheGrafted, Invader, LoneWolf, PileOfBones, SkeletalEnemy

  • Constructor Details

    • Enemy

      public Enemy(String name, char displayChar, int hitPoints, Species species, GameMap map)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the Actor
      displayChar - the character that will represent the Actor in the display
      hitPoints - the Actor's starting hit points
      species - the enemies species
      map - the map that the enemy is on

  • Method Details

    • allowableActions

      public ActionList allowableActions(Actor otherActor, String direction, GameMap map)
      Returns a new collection of the Actions that the otherActor can do to the current Actor.
      Overrides:
      allowableActions in class Actor
      Parameters:
      otherActor - the Actor that might be performing attack
      direction - String representing the direction of the other Actor
      map - current GameMap
      Returns:
      A collection of Actions.

    • playTurn

      public Action playTurn(ActionList actions, Action lastAction, GameMap map, Display display)
      Select and return an action to perform on the current turn. for enemies, this is done via behaviours so the action list is not accessed at all
      Specified by:
      playTurn in class Actor
      Parameters:
      actions - collection of possible Actions for this Actor
      lastAction - The Action this Actor took last turn. Can do interesting things in conjunction with Action.getNextAction()
      map - the map containing the Actor
      display - the I/O object to which messages may be written
      Returns:
      the Action to be performed

    • reset

      public void reset(ResetEvent trigger)
      Reset this enemy, despawning it from the map and deregistering it as a resettable
      Specified by:
      reset in interface Resettable

    • getBehaviours

      public Map<Integer,Behaviour> getBehaviours()
      Get this enemies behaviour map

    • setBehaviours

      public void setBehaviours(Map<Integer,Behaviour> behaviours)
      Sets the enemies behaviour map to a new one
      Parameters:
      behaviours - a new behaviour map

    • getRuneRange

      public int[] getRuneRange()
      Get the range of runes to give to the player if they killed us. Any enemy that drops runes will override this method with values above 0. (By default, drop no runes)
      Returns:
      an array of the integers with the lower and upper bound
